[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_hash160()] [Cost Formula] Is linear cost (n * 1 + 201) adequate for hash160 which typically has more expensive per-byte costs? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_sha256()] [Cost Underestimation] The formula (n * 1 + 100) seems very cheap - can attackers exploit this to hash large amounts of data cheaply? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_sha512()] [Cost Consistency] Why does sha512 cost (n * 1 + 176) more than sha256 (n * 1 + 100) when both have similar computational complexity? (Low)
[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_sha512t256()] [Cost Formula] Is (n * 1 + 188) correct for sha512/256 truncated variant? (Low)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_keccak256()] [Cost Formula] Is (n * 1 + 221) sufficient for keccak256 which is typically more expensive than SHA2? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_secp256k1recover()] [Fixed Cost Risk] Is u14344 sufficient for secp256k1 recovery across all valid inputs, including edge cases? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_secp256k1verify()] [Fixed Cost Risk] Is u13540 correct for signature verification, and does it account for invalid signature rejection costs? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_print()] [Cost Formula] Can the formula (n * 3 + 1413) be exploited by printing massive amounts of data to logs? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_at_block()] [I/O Accounting] Does at_block correctly account for the block header lookup with read_count u1 and read_length u1? (Medium)
[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_at_block()] [Fixed Cost Risk] Is runtime u210 sufficient for at-block which may require state reconstruction? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_load_contract()] [Integer Overflow] Can read_length formula (n * 1 + 1) overflow for maximum-size contracts? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_create_var()] [I/O Accounting] Why is write_count u2 for variable creation - what are the two writes? (Low)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_create_ft()] [Fixed Cost Risk] Why is FT creation fixed at u1972 regardless of token configuration complexity? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_set_entry()] [I/O Accounting] Does read_count u1 with read_length u0 correctly model the read-before-write pattern? (Medium)
